alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 06 at 8:41PM EDT until July 06 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Franklin County in northeastern Georgia... Stephens County in northeastern Georgia... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 834 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northeast of Carnesville, or near Martin, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Toccoa, Carnesville, Lavonia, Gumlog, Martin, Avalon, Tugaloo State Park, Boydville and Eastanolee. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
